lj.lj_ly: she hasn't got two brass farthings to rub together.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)start to consider the basic facts or practical details
(N. Amer. informal)success, typically as regarded as a reward for ambition or hard work

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  bræs, of unknown origin

entry.tran: （尤用于制作装饰品和乐器的）黄铜
entry.def: Brass is a yellow-coloured metal made from copper and zinc. It is used especially for making ornaments and musical instruments.

example.ex: The instrument is beautifully made in brass.
example.tran: 这个仪器是用黄铜制成的，非常漂亮。

entry.tran: （交响乐队的）铜管乐乐器组，铜管乐器
entry.def: The brass is the section of an orchestra which consists of brass wind instruments such as trumpets and horns.

example.ex: He once again raised his baton and brought in the brass.
example.tran: 他再次举起指挥棒，让铜管乐部加入进来。

entry.def: Brasses are flat pieces of brass with writing or a picture cut into them, which are often found in churches.

entry.tran: （军队或其他机构的）高级军官，高层人物
entry.def: In the army or in other organizations, the brass are the people in the highest positions.

example.ex: The brass are reluctant to fraternise with the enlisted men.
example.tran: 高级军官不愿意与大兵们称兄道弟。

entry.tran: 讨论基本事实；探讨实质问题
entry.def: If you get down to brass tacks, you discuss the basic, most important facts of a situation.

example.ex: Angola's ruling party was due to get down to brass tacks today with a debate on the party's record.
example.tran: 安哥拉执政党预定在今天就有关该党执政记录的问题进行实质性讨论。

means.word_mean: 1. an alloy of copper and zinc
2. a wind instrument that consists of a brass tube (usually of variable length) blown by means of a cup-shaped or funnel-shaped mouthpiece
3. the persons (or committees or departments etc.) who make up a body for the purpose of administering something;

sentences.sentence: "he claims that the present administration is corrupt"
"the governance of an association is responsible to its members"
"he quickly became recognized as a member of the establishment"
"he had the effrontery to question my honesty"

means.word_mean: 5. an ornament or utensil made of brass
6. the section of a band or orchestra that plays brass instruments

example.en: Shut up your mouth or you and I will part brass-rags.
example.zh: 闭上你的嘴，要不我与你就此一刀两断。

example.en: He seems to have finally parted brass-rags with the Arab nationalists.
example.zh: 他好像终于与阿拉伯民族主义分子断绝来往。

list.explanation: 厚奖，发財机会，成功机遇

example.en: grab for the brass ring coming around
example.zh: 抓住送上门来的发财机会

example.en: He missed the brass ring at the last convention.
example.zh: 他在上次的大会上失去了获胜的良机。

list.explanation: (政界的)高级官员，(军界的)高级将领，头头，要人

example.en: When are the brass hats going to start paying attention to the important things?
example.zh: 那些高级官员们准备要到什么时候才开始关注这些重要的事情吶？

example.en: A brass hat came up to me and asked me where I was going.
example.zh: 一位高级军官走到我跟前，问我要往哪儿去。

example.en: The brass collar is giving everyone a bonus at the end of the year.
example.zh: 头头准备在年底给大家发一笔奖金。

example.en: He，s the brass hat in Washington right now.
example.zh: 眼下他是华盛顿的要人。

sentences.en: Formerly most of our household utensils were made of brass.
sentences.cn: 以前我们家庭用的器皿多数是用黄铜做的。

means.word_mean: 铜管乐器; 铜管乐队

sentences.cn: 铜管乐器的声音太响了。

sentences.en: How did she have the brass to ask for more?
sentences.cn: 她怎么有脸开口再要呢?

jushi.english: How did she have the brass to do that?
jushi.chinese: 她怎么有脸做那种事呢?

jushi.english: I read her name on the polished brass plate.
jushi.chinese: 我在擦亮的黄铜门牌上看到了她的名字。

jushi.english: Formerly most of our household utensils were made of brass.
jushi.chinese: 以前我们家庭用的器皿多数是用黄铜做的。
